translated: The first is the seed of Tara, then comes Durga, the pair, and Raksha, then Svaha - this is the ten-syllabled mantra.

original: jaya durgā ca na śyāmā pātu māṃ sarvato mudā //
analyzed: jaya durgā ca na śyāmā pātu mām sarvatas mudā
translated: Be victorious, O Durga, who is not dark, protect me from all directions with joy.

original: māyā bījā śira pātu dasavarṇā ca taḥ parā /🔽
analyzed: māyā bījā śira pātu dasavarṇā ca taḥ parā  Ro
translated: May the seed syllable of Maya protect my head, and the ten-syllabled one after that.

analyzed: pratapta kāṃcanā bhāsā jaya durgā nanavatu
translated: May the victorious Durga, shining like molten gold, protect me.

analyzed: tāram hrīṃ duduḥrgāyai namaḥ uṣṭa varṇa nmikā pārā
translated: The eight-syllabled mantra Om, Hrim, salutations to Durga

analyzed: dharā mām dakṣiṇā iva tu
translated: May the goddess holding a conch, a discus and a mace protect me on the right side.

analyzed: mahiṣamardanī svāhā vasu varṇā amikā parā
translated: Mahishasurmardini, svaha - this nine-syllabled mantra

analyzed: naiṛtyā sarvadā pātu mahiṣa asura nāsinī
translated: May the destroyer of the demon Mahisha always protect me from the southwest.
Maya, Padavati, svaha - this seven-syllabled mantra is well-known.

original: padmāvatī padmasaṃsthā paścime māṃ sadā pātu /
analyzed: padmāvatī padma saṃsthā paścime mām sadā pātu
translated: May Padavati, seated on a lotus, always protect me from the west.

analyzed: pāśa aṃkuśa puṭāmāyai himara parameśvari svāhā
translated: Maya, Ankuka, Pasha, Khechara, Hrim, Ksh, Hrim, Phut, Mahavidya, Svaha - this twelve-syllabled great mantra grants all.

analyzed: jayaḥ tu
translated: Jayo, Dasa, Akshara, Arnada, Svaha - may this ten-syllabled mantra always protect me from the north.

original: sarasvati pañcaśaro nityā klinne mada drave //
analyzed: sarasvati pañcaśaraḥ nityā klinne mada drave
translated: Sarasvati, Panchashara, Nitya, Klinna, Mad, Drava, Svaha - this eight-syllabled mantra

original: svāhāratyakṣarī nityā mānuttara sadāvatu /🔽tāraṃ māyā kavacaṃ khecarakṣa tato vadhu //
analyzed: svāhā aratyakṣarī nityā mā anuttara sadā avatu  tāram māyā kavacam khecarakṣa tatas vadhu
translated: Arati, Akshari, Nitya, Manantara, Svaha - may this eight-syllabled mantra always protect me from above.

original: krūo kṣa hrī phaṭ mahāvidyā dvādaśārṇākhila pradā /🔽
analyzed: krūo kṣa hrī phaṭ mahāvidyā dvādaśa arṇa akhila pradā 🔽Ro
translated: Om, Maya, Kavacha, Khechara, Ksh, Hrim, Phut, Mahavidya, Svaha - this twelve-syllabled great mantra grants all.🔽Jayo, Dasa, Akshara, Arnada, Svaha - may this ten-syllabled mantra always protect me from the north.

original: ariṣṭādibhiḥ pāyācchiva kāṇe sadā ca māṃ /🔽ai klī sauḥ sātatīvālāmāmurddhā daśetovatu //
analyzed: ariṣṭa ādibhiḥ pāyāt śiva kāṇe sadā ca mām  ai klī sauḥ
translated: May Shiva, always protect me from inauspiciousness etc.🔽May the goddess with the syllable Ai Klim Sauh, always protect me from the head.

original: vindvantā bhairavī vālā bhūmau māṃ sarvadāvatu /
analyzed: vindvantā bhairavī vālā bhūmau mām sarvadā avatu
translated: May the goddess Bhairavi, with the syllable Vindvantam, always protect me on the ground.

original: iti te kathitaṃ puṇyaṃ trailokya maṃgalaṃ paraṃ //
analyzed: iti te kathitam puṇyam trailokya maṃgalam param
translated: Thus, I have told you this meritorious and supremely auspicious hymn for the three worlds.

analyzed: sārārataram puṇyam vigraham
translated: This is the essence of the essence, meritorious, and the embodiment of the great knowledge.

original: asyāpi paṭhanāt sadyaḥ kuveropi dhaneśvaraḥ //🔽idrādyāḥ sakalā devā dhāraṇāt paṭhanādyataḥ /
analyzed: asya api paṭhanāt sadyas kuveraḥ api dhaneśvaraḥ  idra ādyāḥ sakalāḥ devāḥ dhāraṇāt paṭhanāt yatas
translated: By reciting this, even Kubera, the lord of wealth,

analyzed: sarva siddhi śvarāḥ santaḥ sarva aiśvaryam avāpnuyāḥ
translated: All the gods including Indra, become the lords of all accomplishments and attain all prosperity, by remembering and reciting this.

original: puṣpāñjalyaṣṭakaṃ dadyān mūle naiva pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: puṣpa añjali aṣṭakam dadyāt mūle nā eva pṛthak pṛthak
translated: One should offer eight flower-offerings at the root, separately.

analyzed: phalam āpnuyāḥ
translated: One will attain the fruits of worship for a hundred years.

analyzed: kṛtvā gṛhaḥ
translated: Having attained love and other things, the abode of Lakshmi,

original: vāṇī ca nivasedvaktre satyaṃ satyaṃ tvamaṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: vāṇī ca nivaset vaktre satyam satyam tvam aṃśayaḥ
translated: And speech resides in the mouth, it is true, it is true, you are the embodiment of truth.

analyzed: yaḥ dhārayati  Ro
translated: He who remembers the most meritorious hymn called Lokya Mangala,

analyzed: kavacam paramam puṇyam saḥ api puṇyavatām varaḥ
translated: He too is the best among the meritorious,

original: sarvaśvarya yuto bhūtvā trailokya vijayī bhavet //
analyzed: sarva aśvarya yutaḥ bhūtvā trailokya vijayī bhavet
translated: Endowed with all prosperity, he becomes victorious in the three worlds.

original: puruṣo dakṣiṇe vāhau nālī vāma bhuje tathā /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ dakṣiṇe vāhau nālī vāma bhuje tathā
translated: The man should have the Nali (a kind of reed) on the right arm and on the left arm as well.

original: vahu putravatī bhūtvā vaṃdhyāpi labhate sutaṃ //
analyzed: vahu putravatī bhūtvā vaṃdhyā api labhate sutam
translated: Even a barren woman, having many sons, obtains a son.

analyzed: brahmāstra ādiṇi naivadam śānti taṃjanam
translated: This is the peace-giving mantra for the Brahma weapon and others.

analyzed: etat kavacam a jñātvā jānujāḥ bhuvaneśvarīm
translated: Without knowing this armor, one should know Bhuvaneśvarī, the mother of the universe.

original: dāridryaṃ paramaṃ prāpya so cirān mṛtyumāpnuyā /
analyzed: dāridryam paramam prāpya saḥ cirāt mṛtyum āpnuyāḥ
translated: Having attained great poverty, one would attain death after a long time.

original: iti śrīrudrayāmale devī īśvarasaṃvāde trailokyamaṃgalaṃ nāma bhuvaneśvarī
analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale devī īśvara saṃvāde trailokyamaṃgalam nāma bhuvaneśvarī
translated: Thus ends the Bhuvaneśvarī Trailokya-maṅgala-nāma-kavaca in the Devi-Īśvara-saṃvāda of Śrī Rudra-yāmala.

analyzed: kavacam saṃpūrṇam
translated: The armor is complete.

analyzed: atha dhūmāvatīkavacam āhaḥ
translated: Now, he says the Dhūmāvatī Kavaca.

analyzed: pārvatī uvāca
translated: Pārvatī said:

analyzed: devadevam mahādeva bhakta anugraha kārakaḥ
translated: O Mahādeva, god of gods, who shows grace to devotees,

original: dhūmāvatyāśru kavacaṃ tu bruhi me karuṇā nidhe //
analyzed: dhūmāvatyā aśru kavacam tu bruhi me karuṇā nidhe
translated: O abode of compassion, tell me the Dhūmāvatī Kavaca.

analyzed: mahādevaḥ uvāca
translated: Mahādeva said:

original: asti guhyatamaṃ loke kavacaṃ śatru nigrahaṃ /
analyzed: asti guhyatamam loke kavacam
translated: There is a most secret armor in the world for subduing enemies,

original: sarvasthita pradaṃ devi tava snehāṃ prakāśyate //🔽
analyzed: pradam devi tava prakāśyate  Ro
translated: which, O Goddess, is being revealed out of affection for you, and which grants everything when present.

analyzed: yat śutvā rāmacandreṇa saṃgare rāvane hataḥ
translated: Having heard which, Rāmacandra killed Rāvaṇa in battle,

analyzed: yat śutvā ajitam sarvam carācasam
translated: and having heard which, Bhogaveda conquered all the moving and unmoving.

analyzed: tam eva kavacam vacmi sa avadhāna avadhāraya
translated: I will tell that very armor, understand attentively.

original: kavacasya mahādevi pipyada ṛṣiḥ smṛtaḥ //🔽cchandro virāṭ devatā ca śrīmaddhumavatī priye /
analyzed: kavacasya mahādevi pipyadaḥ ṛṣiḥ smṛtaḥ  chandraḥ virāj devatā ca śrīmat dhumavatī priye
translated: O Great Goddess, the sage is remembered as Pipyada for the armor.🔽O Beloved, the meter is Virata, and the deity is the illustrious Humavati.

analyzed: śatruṇām māraṇā devi vinī yogaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: O Goddess, the Vinayoga is proclaimed for the slaying of enemies.

original: tu dhūmāvatāṃ sadā pātu śiro me śatru mardini /
analyzed: tu dhūmāvatām sadā pātu śiraḥ me śatru mardini
translated: Always protect my head, O destroyer of enemies.

original: caṇḍarūpā mahādevī lalāṭa pātu māṃ sadā //🔽kṣukṣā māṃ nayane pātu pātu mā śrutī mamaḥ /
analyzed: caṇḍarūpā mahādevī lalāṭa pātu mām sadā  kṣukṣā mām nayane pātu pātu mā śrutī
translated: The fierce-formed Great Goddess should always protect my forehead.🔽Let Kshukksha protect my eyes, and let her protect my ears.

original: kāka dhvajā nāsikāṃ me sarvaśatru vināśīnī //🔽praṇamvī sadā pātu vadanaṃ muṇḍamālikā /
analyzed: kāka dhvajā nāsikām me sarva śatru vināśīnī  praṇamvī sadā pātu vadanam muṇḍamālikā
translated: The crow-bannered one, the destroyer of all enemies, should always protect my nose.🔽The garland of severed heads should always protect my face with salutations.

original: vikṛtāsyā sadā pātu galaṃ me ripu sundarī //
analyzed: vikṛta āsyā sadā pātu galam me sundarī
translated: The one with a distorted face, the beautiful destroyer of enemies, should always protect my throat.

original: dhū bījaṃ khyā sadā pātu ghāṭa me riṣṭitāriṇī /
analyzed: dhū bījam khyā sadā pātu me riṣṭi tāriṇī
translated: The seed syllable of smoke should always protect my cheeks, O destroyer of misfortune.

analyzed: skadhaukaṃkāli
translated: The skeleton of the skull

analyzed: samāptam
translated: is complete

analyzed: apūrṇam asti
translated: is incomplete
